theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Remodeling and Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory focuses on epigenetic remodeling in immune cells and accelerated epigenetic aging linked to immune dysfunction and inflammation after treatment, fitting a theme of immune-related epigenetic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Remodeling and Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accelerated epigenetic aging induced by physical trauma with immune dysregulation and inflammation driving aging, aligning with immune and inflammation-related epigenetic remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Remodeling and Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Chemotherapy-induced epigenetic changes in brain regions causing cognitive decline resemble brain aging and involve immune and inflammatory pathways, fitting immune/inflammation-related epigenetic remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Remodeling and Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Psychosocial stress triggers epigenetic changes that activate inflammatory pathways and accelerate aging, linking stress, immune signaling, and epigenetic remodeling.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Intergenerational epigenetic inheritance alters longevity pathways including mTORC1 overactivation, which drives systemic aging and inflammation, fitting immune and signaling pathway epigenetic remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenomic Instability and Variability Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenomic Instability and Variability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: DNA methylation regulates age-related disease genes with distinct methylation patterns in centenarians, linking epigenomic variability to disease and longevity.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Disruption of chromatin remodeler PASG causes DNA hypomethylation, genome instability, and premature aging, linking chromatin repression loss to aging.
